original: Bergström, Kurt Johan, med. dr, förste provinsialläkare, Jönköping, f. 23/7/91 i Lidingö av agronom R. A. B. o. Lovisa Bergman. G. 1. 20-31; 2. 32 m. Inga Anderson. Barn: Marianne f. 33, Marguerite 36, Inga Brita 37. — Stud:ex. 10, med. kand. 15, med. lic. 20 o. med. dr 36, allt i Sthlm. Stud:res. t. Brasil. o. Argentina 20. Marinläk :stip. 17, und:läk. v. Garnisjukh. i Sthlm kir. avd. 21, miarinläk. av 2. gr. 21, av 1. gr. 23, i res. 23-40, und :läk. v. Löts sanat. 23, prov:läk. i Grönskåra distr. 23-30, tf. förste prov:läk. i Jönköp. 1. fyra mån. 25-26, dito i Kalmar 1. sju mån. 28-29, förste prov:läk. i Gotl. 1. samt proviläk. i Visby distr. 30, läk. v. Visby epidrsjukh. o. lärov. s. å., förste prov:läk. i Jönköp. 1. sed. 39. Led. av direkt, f. Visby hosp. 30-39, av direkt. f. statens anst. f. fallandesjuka i Jönköp. sed. 39. Hed:led. av Gotl. djurskyddsfören. o. Kråksmåla-Fager-hults hembygdsfören., hed :ordf. i Flottans män i Jönköp. Skr.: arb. i epidemivård, skolhygien, personhist. m. m. RNO, RVO, GVrsOlM, Sv. djurskyddsfören. med., Skyttem. i guld.
translated: Bergström, Kurt Johan, MD, chief county medical officer, Jönköping, b. July 23, 1891 in Lidingö to agronomist R.A.B. and Lovisa Bergman. Married 1. 1920-1931; 2. 1932 to Inga Anderson. Children: Marianne b. 1933, Marguerite b. 1936, Inga Brita b. 1937. Education: high school exam 1910, Bachelor of Medicine 1915, licentiate of medicine 1920, doctorate of medicine 1936, all in Stockholm. Study visits to Brazil and Argentina in 1920. Marine medical stipendiate in 1917, assistant physician at the Garrison Hospital in Stockholm surgical department in 1921, marine medical officer of second grade in 1921, of first grade in 1923, in reserve 1923-1940, assistant physician at Löts sanatorium in 1923, county medical officer in Grönskåra district 1923-1930, acting chief county medical officer in Jönköping for four months in 1925-1926, the same in Kalmar for seven months in 1928-1929, chief county medical officer in Gotland and county medical officer in Visby district in 1930, physician at Visby epidratuberculosis hospital and school the same year, chief county medical officer in Jönköping since 1939. Member of the board of directors for Visby hospital 1930-1939 and for the state institution for epileptic patients in Jönköping since 1939. Honorary member of the Gotland animal welfare association and Kråksmåla-Fagerhult local history association, honorary chairman of Flottan's Men in Jönköping. Writings on epidemic management, school hygiene, personal history, and more. Awards: Royal Order of the North Star, Order of Vasa, Gold Medal for Military Shooting, Swedish Animal Welfare Association Medal.

structured.name: Kurt Johan Bergström

award.name: Royal Order of the North Star

structured.description: Kurt Johan Bergström was a Swedish MD and chief county medical officer in Jönköping. He was born on July 23, 1891 in Lidingö to agronomist R.A.B. and Lovisa Bergman. Bergström had two marriages and three children named Marianne, Marguerite, and Inga Brita. He got his high school exam in 1910 and finished his Bachelor of Medicine, Licentiate of Medicine, and Doctorate of Medicine in Stockholm University in 1915, 1920, and 1936 respectively. Bergström had various roles in the medical field such as Assistant Physician, Marine Medical Officer, and Provinsialläkare. He also became a member of board of directors for Visby hospital and state institution for epileptic patients in Jönköping. Bergström received several honors and awards throughout his career.
